sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Find the rank of the matrix:

$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 & -3 \\ 2 & -4 & -6 \\ 3 & -6 & -9 \end{bmatrix}$
message_2:
To find the rank of the matrix, we need to perform row operations to get it in its row-echelon form and then count the number of non-zero rows.

Let's perform row operations:

1. Subtract 2 times the first row from the second row:

$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 & -3 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 3 & -6 & -9 \end{bmatrix}$

2. Subtract 3 times the first row from the third row:

$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 & -3 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$

Now the matrix is in row-echelon form. There is only one non-zero row, so the rank of the matrix is 1.
